subtitle: These tasty barbecued roulades can be cooked under a preheated grill if preferred (or if it starts to rain!).

method.text: Beat the softened butter, crushed garlic, lemon rind and juice and the parsley together until well blended. Shape into a long thin roll and wrap in greaseproof paper. Chill in the freezer for about 1 hour or until very hard.
Place the turkey steaks between two sheets of greaseproof or baking parchment paper. Bash with a meat mallet or rolling pin until flattened to about 6mm thick. Place the turkey on a chopping board.
Trim any fat from the Parma ham and use to cover the turkey steaks.

Divide the chilled butter into four pieces and place on top of the ham. Roll up the turkey, ensuring that the butter is completely encased. Tie with fine string or thread to secure. Chill, covered, until required.
Brush the roulades liberally with the melted butter. Place over the hot coals for 10-12 min, or until cooked, brushing with butter and turning occasionally.
To serve, discard the string or thread and cut into slices.

title: Turkey Kiev roulades
